org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement

Class UnderReplicatedBlocks

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.UnderReplicatedBlocks
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Block>

     class UnderReplicatedBlocks
extends Object
implements Iterable<Block>
    Keep prioritized queues of under replicated blocks. Blocks have replication priority, with priority QUEUE_HIGHEST_PRIORITY indicating the highest priority.

    Having a prioritised queue allows the BlockManager to select which blocks to replicate first -it tries to give priority to data that is most at risk or considered most valuable.

    The policy for choosing which priority to give added blocks is implemented in getPriority(Block, int, int, int).

    The queue order is as follows:

    1. QUEUE_HIGHEST_PRIORITY: the blocks that must be replicated first. That is blocks with only one copy, or blocks with zero live copies but a copy in a node being decommissioned. These blocks are at risk of loss if the disk or server on which they remain fails.
    2. QUEUE_VERY_UNDER_REPLICATED: blocks that are very under-replicated compared to their expected values. Currently that means the ratio of the ratio of actual:expected means that there is less than 1:3.
      3. . These blocks may not be at risk, but they are clearly considered "important".
    3. QUEUE_UNDER_REPLICATED: blocks that are also under replicated, and the ratio of actual:expected is good enough that they do not need to go into the QUEUE_VERY_UNDER_REPLICATED queue.
    4. QUEUE_REPLICAS_BADLY_DISTRIBUTED: there are as least as many copies of a block as required, but the blocks are not adequately distributed. Loss of a rack/switch could take all copies off-line.
    5. QUEUE_WITH_CORRUPT_BLOCKS This is for blocks that are corrupt and for which there are no-non-corrupt copies (currently) available. The policy here is to keep those corrupt blocks replicated, but give blocks that are not corrupt higher priority.

             int oldReplicas,
             int decommissionedReplicas,
             int oldExpectedReplicas)
        remove a block from a under replication queue

      • remove

        boolean remove(Block block,
             int priLevel)
        Remove a block from the under replication queues. The priLevel parameter is a hint of which queue to query first: if negative or >= LEVEL this shortcutting is not attmpted. If the block is not found in the nominated queue, an attempt is made to remove it from all queues. Warning: This is not a synchronized method.
        Parameters:
        block - block to remove
        priLevel - expected privilege level
        Returns:
        true if the block was found and removed from one of the priority queues

      • update

        void update(Block block,
          int curReplicas,
          int decommissionedReplicas,
          int curExpectedReplicas,
          int curReplicasDelta,
          int expectedReplicasDelta)
        Recalculate and potentially update the priority level of a block. If the block priority has changed from before an attempt is made to remove it from the block queue. Regardless of whether or not the block is in the block queue of (recalculate) priority, an attempt is made to add it to that queue. This ensures that the block will be in its expected priority queue (and only that queue) by the end of the method call.
        Parameters:
        block - a under replicated block
        curReplicas - current number of replicas of the block
        decommissionedReplicas - the number of decommissioned replicas
        curExpectedReplicas - expected number of replicas of the block
        curReplicasDelta - the change in the replicate count from before
        expectedReplicasDelta - the change in the expected replica count from before

      • chooseUnderReplicatedBlocks

        public List<List<Block>> chooseUnderReplicatedBlocks(int blocksToProcess)
        Get a list of block lists to be replicated. The index of block lists represents its replication priority. Replication index will be tracked for each priority list separately in priorityToReplIdx map. Iterates through all priority lists and find the elements after replication index. Once the last priority lists reaches to end, all replication indexes will be set to 0 and start from 1st priority list to fulfill the blockToProces count.
        Parameters:
        blocksToProcess - - number of blocks to fetch from underReplicated blocks.
        Returns:
        Return a list of block lists to be replicated. The block list index represents its replication priority.
